body:
I didn't think reddit was really as bad as it's being presented here, initially.

Then I found out about this website: https://masstagger.com

It is a tool that can be used to instantly reduce any discussion to "you post in such and such subreddit, so we're all gonna downvote you and not read what you actually say."

For any given user, it will tell you what subreddits they have posted in, and for each subreddit it will tell you the exact amount of posts and how much karma was gained from these posts. Note that it only checks a *very* specific subset of "hate" subreddits, which happens to be, you guessed it, literally any right wing subreddit.

I absolutely do not consider myself right-wing, but this website serves only to remove any non-toxic discussion that might still exist on reddit, and replace it with ad hominem back and forth.

Read the FAQ. The guy who made it recognizes all of these effects, and does not see the problem.

The website is being used to striking effect in many places on reddit.

title: Masstagger, because there isn't enough toxicity on reddit.

author.bio:
Morons glorifying Nazis or demonizing Jews are just as bad as the morons who glorify Marxists and demonize anybody to their Right.  

Both are a threat to free discourse, both would have you kneel to their philosophy, and both infest social media.

Both are a threat to free discourse, both would have you kneel to their philosophy, and both infest social media.

body:
This doesn't surprise me a bit.  

Reddit seems full of people with not only a lack of self-awareness, but an inability (or unwillingness) to consider the unintended side-effects of the implementation of all the great plans they propose.

body:
From the site:
*
Isn't this promoting division rather than unity? - Widely, yes, I do think so. What I don't believe is that that's neccesarily a bad thing. My primary goal with this tagger is to tag users of hate subreddits. I.e. the kind of users that cannot be reasoned or compromised with.*
body_html: From the site: * Isn't this promoting division rather than unity? - Widely, yes, I do think so. What I don't believe is that that's neccesarily a bad thing. My primary goal with this tagger is to tag users of hate subreddits. I.e. the kind of users that cannot be reasoned or compromised with.*
